sentences: Olen süvamuusikaga sinasõbraks saanud 'olen süvamuusikat lähemalt tundma õppinud, oskan seda nautida.'
Ma ei oska eesti keelt rääkida.
Oska lennata ja siis tule tagasi.
context: The word 'oskan' is the first-person singular present indicative form of the Estonian verb 'oskama', which means 'to know how to' or 'can'. It indicates ability or capability in the present tense for the speaker (I). The dictionary definition shows it's used when expressing skills or abilities, such as knowing how to play chess ('oskab hästi maletada') or being able to enjoy deep music after learning about it. This form specifically belongs to 'mina' (I) and is used in present tense contexts.
